Thomas Nolte About Portfolio

BumbleBee Printer

BumbleBee is a 3D printer myself and 3 other students built for our Junior Design class at UNCA. The goal of the class wasto introduce and teach studnets about 3D printers and also inprove our planning and team working skills
The goal of our printer was to increase printing speed by reducing the mass of the head to maintain accuracy. To reach this goal we opted to use a bowden extruder and to use fishing line to reduce the momentum of the movement system. The printer was also equipped with a headed bed and is designed to accomadate panels for enclosing.

This site was built using Jekyll and is hosted on Github Photos from Unsplash and text generated with Hipster Ipsum. © 2015
